RelatedSentence: The London imam Abu Hamza al - Masri was convicted of terrorism charges in New York on Monday , following a four - week trial that shined a spotlight on the preacher 's controversial anti-Western statements .
A jury of eight men and four women found Abu Hamza , 56 , guilty on all 11 counts he faced .

The former imam of London mosque Finsbury Park faces a possible life sentence .
The 56 - year - old , who was extradited from Britain in October , faces up to life in prison if convicted on the 11 counts against him .

Blind in one eye and with both hands amputated , Mustafa Kamel Mustafa , his real name , gained notoriety as the imam of the Finsbury mosque in London , the center of an Islamist network during the 1990 s that became known as Londonistan .
He was also accused of trying to set up a terrorist training camp in the United States in 1999 , and of promoting violent jihad on a global scale .
